name: Erythritol
desc: Erythritol is an organic chemical compound, a food additive used as a sweetener. Its code number in the European Union is E968. Erythritol occurs naturally in some fruits, fermented foods, seaweed or red wine. This food ingredient can also be obtained by fermentation of glucose.
techs: Erythritol is a white crystalline granule that is practically odorless and has a very sweet taste. It is highly soluble in water and slightly soluble in ethanol.
shelf: The shelf life of Erythritol is 36 months. Bags should be stored away from sunlight, in an odor-free environment. For storing low humidity is recommended to minimize the risk of caking or degradation potentials.
packaging: Foodcom supplies its Business Partners with Erythritol in 25 kg bags.
applications: Erythritol is usually applied in the food industry as a sweetener. The commodity can also be used as an inhibitor of flavor and texture changes, as a flavor enhancer, or as a thickening agent. Erythritol is also applied in cosmetics as a substitute for glycerin or in pharmaceuticals for the production of tablet mass.
